wrath.util

Class Config

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrath.util.Config

  • public class Config
extends java.lang.Object
    Basic, extendable configuration system. Creates a simple 'key: value' config file and stores it in a map. Set Properties with the setProperty(String, String) method and use any get() method to retrieve them. All error handling and parsing is done here as well.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor.

        Parameters:

      • setProperty

        public void setProperty(java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.Object value)
        Sets a property's value. For other variables (like boolean), just type it in string form. e.g. "false".
        Parameters:
        key - The key of the configuration value to query
        value - The value to place in the configuration. This will be formatted to a String using the Object.toString() method. Note that if the intended value is an array of objects, set the value argument as Config.arrayToConfigValue(value)!

      • save

        public void save()
        Saves the config currently stored in memory to file defined in constructor.

      • save

        public void save(java.io.File file)
        Parameters:
        file -

      • save

        public void save(java.io.File file,
                 boolean force)
        Saves the config currently stored in memory to specified file.
        Parameters:
        file - The File to save the config to.
        force - If true, config will save even if it must override the previous file.

      • arrayToConfigValue

        public static java.lang.Object arrayToConfigValue(java.lang.Object[] array)
        Converts an array of Objects to a valid Config property to be used in setProperty(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object)
        Parameters:
        array - The array of objects to convert. Each element will be converted to a string using the Object.toString() method then formatted into a proper configuration array.
        Returns:
        Returns the Object that has been properly formatted to be used as a value in setProperty(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object).
